  • Constructor Details

    • JavaCodeGenerator

      public JavaCodeGenerator()
      Creates a new JavaCodeGenerator that writes to the specified writer

  • Method Details

    • unique

      public String unique(String name)
      Returns:
      the name with a unique integer appended. The number is unique only for the current scope.

    • parent

      public JavaCodeGenerator parent()
      Returns:
      this code generator's parent or null if top-level

    • generateImport

      public void generateImport(Class<?> aClass)
      Generates an import

    • declare

      public JavaCodeGenerator declare(String type, String name)
      Declares an uninitialized local variable

    • declareExisting

      public JavaCodeGenerator declareExisting(String name)
      Declare a pre-existing variable in the current scope. No code is emitted.

    • declare

      public JavaCodeGenerator declare(String type, String name, String initialValue, Object... args)
      Declares an initialized local variable

    • declareOnScope

      public JavaCodeGenerator declareOnScope(String type, String name, String initialValue)
      Declares an initialized local variable at the beginning of the current scope. Useful to declare temporary variables on complex expressions.

    • declareOnScope

      public static String declareOnScope(JavaCodeGenerator.Scope scope, String type, String name, String initialValue)
      Declares an initialized local variable at the beginning of the current scope. Useful to declare temporary variables on complex expressions.
      Returns:
      the resolved name of the variable

    • printfOnScope

      public JavaCodeGenerator printfOnScope(String format, Object... args)
      Prints the specified code at the beginning of the current scope. Useful to initialize temporary variables on complex expressions.

    • boundedLoop

      public JavaCodeGenerator boundedLoop(String indexVar, String lowerBound, String upperBound, Consumer<JavaCodeGenerator> body)
      Simple bounded loop over an int index variable

    • loop

      public JavaCodeGenerator loop(Consumer<JavaCodeGenerator> body)
      Unbounded loop

    • forEach

      public JavaCodeGenerator forEach(String type, String elementVar, String collection, Consumer<JavaCodeGenerator> body)
      Fore-each loop over an iterable

    • comment

      public void comment(String s, Object... args)
      Emmit a single-line comment. Supports new lines.

    • variable

      public String variable(String name)
      Returns:
      the mangled name of the variable if it's shadowing another on an outer scope

    • printQuoted

      public JavaCodeGenerator printQuoted(String s)
      Print the specified string so it is a valid java string literal.

    • ifThen

      public JavaCodeGenerator ifThen(String condition, Consumer<JavaCodeGenerator> accept)
      Generates a simple if-then statement
